newsitem.title: SWEDEN: P&U sells ReFacto rights to Genetics.
newsitem.headline: P&U sells ReFacto rights to Genetics.

text.p: Swedish/U.S. drugs company Pharmacia & Upjohn said on Thursday it had sold the rights to develop and market the new haemophilia drug ReFacto to Boston's Genetics Institute Inc.
P&U said ReFacto was currently in Phase III clinical trials in Europe and the U.S..
Genetics Institute, which is a wholly owned subsidiary of American Home Products Corp, would continue clinical development of the product with a goal of worldwide registations and marketing.
"Under the terms of the agreement, P&U will perform selected development activities and will manufacture ReFacto for Genetics Institute," a P&U statement said.
"P&U will also have rights to co-promote ReFacto in the Nordic area and the Middle East."
Financial terms for the purchase were not released.
ReFacto is a recombinant Factor VIII product and is formulated without albumin for an added measure of viral safety, P&U said.
